Retrieve flat meta data for a financial asset

Source: R/get_fn.R
get_asset_value.Rd

Internal function to fetch flat (non-nested) meta data for a given asset symbol, such as a stock. Returns a one-row data frame with high-level market and asset information (e.g., prices, volumes, timezones).

Usage

get_asset_value(symbol = "SAAB-B.ST", .verbose = F)

Arguments

symbol

Character. Asset symbol to query (e.g., "AAPL").

.verbose

Logical. If TRUE, enables verbose output for debugging purposes. Default is FALSE.

Value

A data.frame with 1 row per symbol provided and 21 columns see get_values()

See also

get_values

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
last_prices <- get_asset_value("SAAB-B.ST")
str(last_prices)
} # }
